title: Data Theft L1 – File upload – SWG Audit
description: Data theft simulation: file upload types. Upload allowed = perimeter may have failed. Blocked = passed. Max 1 KB.
keywords: SWG Audit, data theft test, file upload, perimeter security
headline: Data Theft – Level 1: File upload types
testObjective: Test whether your SWG can detect and block outbound file uploads to prevent data exfiltration.
attackVector: Insiders or compromised endpoints can exfiltrate sensitive data via file uploads to cloud storage, webmail, or anonymous file-sharing sites.

steps.title: Configure your SWG
steps.description: Whitelist swgaudit.com to allow access to this page. Your SWG should monitor and block file uploads based on type or content.

steps.title: Verify your identity
steps.description: Submit your business email to unlock the simulation.

steps.title: Run the test
steps.description: Select a sample file or upload your own (max 1 KB). If your SWG blocks the upload, it passed. If the upload succeeds, your SWG failed to intercept it. Uploaded files are deleted after 10 minutes.

feedbackFail: File upload succeeded = perimeter may have failed to block the upload.
feedbackPass: Upload blocked or failed = perimeter passed.
